intro: Celmisia traversii, commonly known as the Stewart Island Celmisia, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, often hairy foliage and small, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky areas. It has a compact growth habit and is often found in the subalpine and alpine zones of Stewart Island. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
